q: Plan 03-02 lists 10 agent files in fm but only covers reviewing agents -- what about Critic, Scout, Debugger, Security, and Tester for review ownership language?
ctx: REQ-06 says 'all agent prompts include review ownership language' but plan 03-02 only targets Senior, Lead, Owner, Architect, QA, QA-Code, and their FE/UX variants. Critic reviews requirements, Scout reviews research quality, Debugger reviews evidence. Tester implicitly reviews Senior's ts field. Security reviews code against standards. These 5 agents also perform review activities. Success criteria says 'All agent prompts include review ownership language patterns'.
sug: Clarify whether REQ-06 applies to ALL 26 agents or only agents in explicit reviewer roles. If all 26, add tasks for Critic, Scout, Debugger, Security, and Tester. If not, update success criterion to 'All reviewing agent prompts'.
resolution: D1: Scoped to 16 reviewing agents per Google reviewer taxonomy (R1). Non-reviewing agents (Dev, Tester, Scout, Critic, Debugger, Security) are authors/producers, not reviewers of subordinate output. ROADMAP success criterion updated to 'All reviewing agent prompts (16 of 26)'.

q: No explicit test strategy for Phase 3 -- how will these documentation/prompt changes be verified beyond the audit checklist?
ctx: Phase 3 is entirely documentation changes. Plan 03-04 T5 runs the audit checklist, but there are no automated BATS tests. Existing static tests could be extended to verify new sections exist in agent prompts. Without tests, regression is possible.
sug: Add BATS tests that grep agent files for required sections (Review Ownership Language, Change Management). Aligns with static test category.
resolution: D6: Two new BATS test files -- tests/static/agent-review-ownership.bats (verifies 16 reviewing agents have ## Review Ownership section) and tests/static/protocol-11-step-refs.bats (verifies zero 10-step references remain).

q: Plan 03-01 tasks T1-T3 all write to same file (audit-report.jsonl) -- no td dependencies for teammate mode
ctx: Tasks T1, T2, T3 all have f:[audit-report.jsonl]. File-overlap detection would serialize them, but td field should make sequential dependency explicit.
sug: Add td: T2 depends on T1, T3 depends on T2. Or consolidate into single task.
resolution: Plan-level fix: Lead must add td dependencies (T2->T1, T3->T2) when re-planning, or consolidate audit tasks into single task per architecture guidance.

q: Lead agent prompt references '10-step' workflow but project uses 11-step since Phase 2
ctx: yolo-lead.md line 14 says '10-step'. cross-team-protocol.md lines 28/34/36/55 reference '10-step'. Phase 3 plans do not include task to fix stale references.
sug: Add task to fix all stale '10-step' references to '11-step' across codebase.
resolution: D2: Comprehensive fix across 12 files (19 occurrences). Added as tasks in plan 03-01 audit wave. Static test protocol-11-step-refs.bats validates zero remaining references.

q: R&D handoff protocol covers Critic->Scout->Architect but not Architect->Lead handoff quality criteria
ctx: Plan 03-03 T1 creates rnd-handoff-protocol.md for Critic->Scout->Architect pipeline. But Architect->Lead handoff (architecture.toon completeness criteria, feedback loop) is not formalized.
sug: Extend 03-03 T1 to cover Architect->Lead handoff: what architecture.toon must contain, quality gate, feedback loop.
resolution: D3: Stage-gate model (Go/Recycle/Kill) for Architect->Lead handoff. Entry criteria, completeness checklist, feedback loop via Recycle path. Updates execute-protocol.md Steps 3-4 gates.

q: review-ownership-patterns.md uses Markdown but could use machine-parseable format for enforcement
ctx: Plan 03-02 T1 creates MD doc, T2-T5 manually add sections to 10 agent files. If new agents are added, ownership language could be forgotten without automated validation.
sug: Add JSONL format mapping agent names to expected ownership phrases for automated static test validation.
resolution: D7: CODEOWNERS-style ownership matrix in review-ownership-patterns.md with embedded structured data for BATS test validation. agent-review-ownership.bats uses grep to verify presence.

q: How does change management formalization (03-03 T2) interact with Phase 4's continuous QA system?
ctx: Phase 3 formalizes 2-cycle max revision with Senior. Phase 4 adds QA gates at post-task level. Rigid formalization without extensibility hooks may require Phase 4 to rewrite Phase 3 artifacts.
sug: Design change management section with extensibility in mind: include hook point for post-task QA triggers.
resolution: D4: Extensibility hooks as metric observation points (cycle count, severity distribution, time per cycle). Phase 4 instruments at hook locations without rewriting Phase 3 artifacts. Minor/Major classification enables different QA trigger paths.

q: Plan 03-04 T5 audit verification lacks explicit td dependencies on T1-T4
ctx: T5 runs audit but has no td field. In teammate mode, T5 could theoretically execute before T1-T4 complete.
sug: Add td:['T1','T2','T3','T4'] to T5 in 03-04. Also add 03-03 to plan-level d.
resolution: Plan-level fix: Lead must add td:[T1,T2,T3,T4] to T5 in 03-04 and add 03-03 to plan d field when re-planning.

q: Critic agent has no review ownership language -- who takes ownership of critique quality?
ctx: Nobody explicitly owns critique output quality. Lead forwards it, Architect addresses it. No ownership statement in the chain.
sug: Have Architect state 'This is my critic analysis, I will address each finding thoroughly' when consuming critique.jsonl.
resolution: D1 scope: Architect already owns critique findings per Step 3 protocol (addresses each finding, updates st field). Architect's ## Review Ownership section will include ownership of critique analysis. Architect takes ownership of critique quality when consuming critique.jsonl per R8 responsibility definition.

ctx: Adding a 4th reference doc increases agent cross-referencing overhead. Status reporting is a subset of cross-team communication.
sug: Integrate status reporting as a section within cross-team-protocol.md rather than standalone file.
resolution: D5: Consolidated into cross-team-protocol.md as new ## Cross-Team Status Reporting section. No standalone file needed.
